definition_en: To rise from bed after sleeping.
example: I need to get up early tomorrow for my flight.

definition_en: To have a friendly relationship with someone.
definition_pt: Ter um relacionamento amigável com alguém.
example: She gets along with all her colleagues.

definition_en: To return to a place.
example: What time did you get back from the party?

definition_en: To enter a vehicle.
example: Quick, get in the car before it rains!

definition_en: To leave a vehicle or transportation.
definition_pt: Sair de um veículo ou transporte.
example: Get off at the next bus stop.

definition_en: To enter a vehicle or transportation.
definition_pt: Entrar em um veículo ou transporte.
example: We need to get on the train quickly.

definition_en: To leave or exit a place.
example: Get out of my room right now!

definition_en: To meet socially with someone.
example: Let's get together for coffee next week.

definition_en: To leave the ground (aircraft); to remove clothing.
example: The plane will take off in 10 minutes. / Please take off your shoes.

translation: Tirar para fora / Levar para sair
definition_en: To remove something from a place; to take someone on a date.
definition_pt: Remover algo de um lugar; levar alguém para sair.
example: Take the trash out, please. / He took her out to dinner.

definition_en: To look after someone or something.
example: Can you take care of my plants while I'm away?

definition_en: To resemble a family member in appearance or character.
definition_pt: Assemelhar-se a um familiar na aparência ou caráter.
example: She takes after her mother - they're both very creative.

definition_en: To return something; to retract a statement.
definition_pt: Devolver algo; retirar o que disse.
example: I need to take this book back to the library. / I take back what I said earlier.

definition_en: To search for something or someone.
example: I'm looking for my keys. Have you seen them?

definition_en: To anticipate something with pleasure.
example: I'm really looking forward to our vacation.

definition_en: To take care of someone or something.
example: Can you look after the children while I'm out?

definition_en: To search for information in a reference source.
definition_pt: Buscar informação em uma fonte de referência.
example: If you don't know the word, look it up in the dictionary.

definition_en: To be careful; to watch for danger.
definition_pt: Ter cuidado; ficar atento ao perigo.
example: Look out! There's a car coming!

definition_en: To dress oneself with clothing; to apply something.
example: Put on your coat, it's cold outside. / She put on some makeup.

definition_en: To return something to its proper storage place.
definition_pt: Devolver algo ao seu lugar de armazenamento adequado.
example: Please put away your toys when you finish playing.

definition_en: To postpone something.
example: They put off the meeting until next week.

definition_en: To extinguish a fire.
example: The firefighters put out the forest fire.

definition_en: To tolerate or endure something unpleasant.
example: I don't know how she puts up with his constant complaining.

definition_en: To return to a place.
example: When are you coming back from your trip?

definition_en: To enter a place.
example: Please come in and make yourself comfortable.

definition_en: Used to encourage someone or to express disbelief.
definition_pt: Usado para encorajar alguém ou expressar descrença.
example: Come on, we're going to be late! / Oh come on, you don't really mean that!

definition_en: To originate from a place.
example: Where do you come from originally?

definition_en: To leave home for social activities.
definition_pt: Sair de casa para atividades sociais.
example: We're going out for dinner tonight.

definition_en: To return to a place.
example: I need to go back home to get my wallet.

definition_en: To leave a place.
example: I wish this headache would go away.

definition_en: To continue; to happen.
example: What's going on here? / Please go on with your story.

definition_en: To activate a device or machine.
example: Can you turn on the lights, please?

definition_en: To deactivate a device or machine.
example: Don't forget to turn off the TV before you leave.

definition_en: To increase volume; to arrive or appear.
definition_pt: Aumentar o volume; chegar ou aparecer.
example: Can you turn up the music? / He finally turned up an hour late.

definition_en: To decrease volume; to reject an offer.
definition_pt: Diminuir o volume; recusar uma oferta.
example: Please turn down the radio. / She turned down the job offer.

definition_en: To stop trying; to quit.
example: Don't give up, you can do it!

definition_en: To return something to its owner.
example: I need to give these books back to the library.

definition_en: To distribute something to people.
example: The teacher gave out the exam papers.

definition_en: To succeed in avoiding punishment for something.
example: He cheated on the test and got away with it.

definition_en: To recover from an illness or emotional distress.
definition_pt: Recuperar-se de uma doença ou sofrimento emocional.
example: It took her months to get over the breakup.

definition_en: To survive a difficult period; to complete something.
definition_pt: Sobreviver a um período difícil; completar algo.
example: We need to get through this week, then we can relax.

definition_en: To manage to survive or cope with difficulty.
definition_pt: Conseguir sobreviver ou lidar com dificuldade.
example: They don't earn much, but they get by.

definition_en: To successfully communicate an idea or message.
definition_pt: Comunicar com sucesso uma ideia ou mensagem.
example: I'm trying to get across the importance of this project.

definition_en: To start a new activity or hobby; to occupy space or time.
definition_pt: Começar uma nova atividade ou hobby; ocupar espaço ou tempo.
example: She's taken up photography. / This sofa takes up too much space.

definition_en: To assume control or responsibility for something.
definition_pt: Assumir controle ou responsabilidade por algo.
example: The new manager will take over next month.

definition_en: To disassemble something into pieces.
example: He took the engine apart to see what was wrong.

definition_en: To investigate or examine something.
example: The police are looking into the matter.

definition_en: To admire and respect someone.
example: I've always looked up to my older sister.

definition_en: To regard someone with contempt or superiority.
definition_pt: Considerar alguém com desprezo ou superioridade.
example: She looks down on people who didn't go to college.

definition_en: To suggest an idea or proposal.
example: He put forward a new plan for the project.

definition_en: To connect someone by telephone.
example: Please hold while I put you through to the manager.

definition_en: To provide accommodation; to erect or build.
example: Can you put me up for the night? / They put up a new building.

definition_en: To find or encounter something by chance.
example: I came across this old photo while cleaning.

definition_en: To think of an idea, plan, or solution.
definition_pt: Pensar em uma ideia, plano ou solução.
example: We need to come up with a better strategy.

definition_en: To volunteer information or help.
example: Several witnesses came forward with information.

definition_en: To experience something difficult; to examine carefully.
example: She's going through a difficult time. / I need to go through these documents.

definition_en: To proceed with something; to give permission.
example: Go ahead and start without me.

definition_en: To review or examine something carefully.
example: Let's go over the plan one more time.

definition_en: To agree with or support something.
example: I'll go along with whatever the committee decides.

definition_en: To become something different.
example: The argument turned into a full-blown fight.

definition_en: To result in a particular way; to attend an event.
definition_pt: Resultar de uma maneira particular; comparecer a um evento.
example: The party turned out to be great. / Thousands turned out for the concert.

definition_en: To face the opposite direction; to improve significantly.
definition_pt: Virar para a direção oposta; melhorar significativamente.
example: Turn around and look at me. / The company's fortunes turned around quickly.

definition_en: To surrender or yield to pressure.
example: After hours of arguing, he finally gave in.

definition_en: To donate something; to reveal a secret.
example: We're giving away old clothes. / Don't give away the surprise!

definition_en: To emit or produce something like smell or heat.
definition_pt: Emitir ou produzir algo como odor ou calor.
example: The flowers give off a wonderful fragrance.

definition_en: To stop functioning (machine); to lose emotional control.
definition_pt: Parar de funcionar (máquina); perder controle emocional.
example: My car broke down on the highway. / She broke down in tears.

definition_en: To end a romantic relationship.
example: They broke up after three years together.

definition_en: To start suddenly (war, disease); to escape from prison.
definition_pt: Começar subitamente (guerra, doença); escapar da prisão.
example: War broke out in 1939. / Three prisoners broke out of jail.

definition_en: To enter a building illegally by force.
definition_pt: Entrar em um prédio ilegalmente pela força.
example: Thieves broke into our house last night.

definition_en: To raise children; to mention a topic.
example: She brought up three children alone. / Don't bring up that subject again.

definition_en: To cause something to happen.
example: The new policy brought about significant changes.

definition_en: To move something to an earlier date or time.
definition_pt: Mover algo para uma data ou hora mais cedo.
example: They brought the meeting forward to Tuesday.

definition_en: To release a new product; to reveal a quality.
definition_pt: Lançar um novo produto; revelar uma qualidade.
example: The company is bringing out a new smartphone. / Stress brings out the worst in people.

definition_en: To eventually find time to do something that has been delayed.
definition_pt: Finalmente encontrar tempo para fazer algo que foi adiado.
example: I finally got round to replying to all my emails.

definition_en: To suggest something indirectly.
example: What are you getting at? Just say it directly.

definition_en: To be successful in one's career or life.
definition_pt: Ser bem-sucedido na carreira ou vida.
example: It's hard to get ahead without a good education.

definition_en: To support someone or something.
example: We need to get behind this initiative if we want it to succeed.

definition_en: To develop a liking for someone or something.
definition_pt: Desenvolver afeição por alguém ou algo.
example: I didn't take to him immediately, but he grew on me.

definition_en: To surprise or shock someone.
example: I was taken aback by her sudden anger.

definition_en: To understand information; to deceive someone.
example: It was too much information to take in at once. / She was taken in by his smooth talk.

definition_en: To accept a responsibility or challenge.
example: She's taken on too much work lately.

definition_en: To think about something in the past.
example: When I look back on my childhood, I have fond memories.

definition_en: To rely on or expect help from someone.
definition_pt: Contar com ou esperar ajuda de alguém.
example: We're looking to you for guidance on this matter.

definition_en: To search for different options before deciding.
definition_pt: Buscar por diferentes opções antes de decidir.
example: We should look around before we buy a house.

definition_en: To communicate an idea effectively.
example: She put her points across very clearly in the meeting.

definition_en: To attribute something to a particular cause.
definition_pt: Atribuir algo a uma causa particular.
example: I put his bad mood down to lack of sleep.

definition_en: To wear something until it's comfortable; to interrupt.
definition_pt: Usar algo até ficar confortável; interromper.
example: I need to break in these new shoes. / He broke in with some exciting news.

definition_en: To require or demand something.
example: This recipe calls for two eggs. / The situation calls for immediate action.

definition_en: To continue doing something.
example: Please carry on with your work.

definition_en: To understand; to become popular.
example: He quickly caught on to the new software. / That song is really catching on.

definition_en: To accompany someone; to appear or arrive.
example: You can come along if you want. / A new job opportunity came along.

definition_en: To exit; to be published or released.
example: Come out of the house right now! / Her new book comes out next week.

definition_en: To fasten or close; to decorate.
example: Do up your coat, it's cold. / They did up the old house beautifully.

definition_en: To fall to the ground.
example: Be careful not to fall down on the ice.

definition_en: To lose balance and fall.
example: The child fell over but didn't cry.

definition_en: To discover a fact or piece of information.
definition_pt: Descobrir um fato ou uma informação.
example: I need to find out when the train leaves.

definition_en: To move to a lower level; to feel sad.
definition_pt: Mover-se para um nível inferior; sentir-se triste.
example: Get down from that tree! / This weather is getting me down.

definition_en: To stop hoping or believing in someone/something.
definition_pt: Parar de ter esperança ou acreditar em alguém/algo.
example: Don't give up on me, I can change.

definition_en: To move to a lower place; to be recorded or remembered.
definition_pt: Mover-se para um lugar inferior; ser registrado ou lembrado.
example: The sun goes down in the evening. / This day will go down in history.

translation: Deixar de fazer com a idade
definition_en: To stop doing something as you get older.
definition_pt: Deixar de fazer algo conforme fica mais velho.
example: He grew out of playing with toys.

definition_en: To wait; to grip something tightly.
example: Hold on, I need to tie my shoe. / Hold on to the railing.

definition_en: To continue at the same rate or level.
definition_pt: Continuar no mesmo ritmo ou nível.
example: I can't keep up with all these changes.

definition_en: To disappoint someone.
example: I promised I would help and I don't want to let him down.

definition_en: To examine or read something quickly.
example: Can you look through this report for errors?

definition_en: To compensate for something.
example: I'll make up for the lost time this weekend.

definition_en: To die (a more gentle expression).
example: His grandfather passed away last night.

definition_en: To select or choose.
example: Can you help me pick out a dress for the party?

definition_en: To return something to its original place.
definition_pt: Devolver algo ao seu lugar original.
example: Please put the book back on the shelf when you're done.

definition_en: To meet someone unexpectedly.
example: I ran into my old teacher at the supermarket.

definition_en: To begin a journey; to cause something to activate.
definition_pt: Iniciar uma jornada; fazer algo ativar.
example: We set off at dawn. / The loud noise set off the car alarm.

definition_en: To write something down; to dismantle.
example: Let me take down your phone number. / We need to take down the tent.

definition_en: To discuss something thoroughly.
example: Let's talk over the plans before we decide.

definition_en: To return the way you came.
example: The road was blocked so we had to turn back.

definition_en: To spend time repairing or improving something.
definition_pt: Passar tempo consertando ou melhorando algo.
example: I need to work on my pronunciation.

definition_en: To malfunction; to behave badly.
example: My knee is acting up again. / The children were acting up in class.

definition_en: To reply rudely to someone in authority.
definition_pt: Responder com insolência a alguém em autoridade.
example: Don't answer back to your mother!

definition_en: To withdraw a claim or demand in a conflict.
definition_pt: Retirar uma reivindicação ou demanda em um conflito.
example: He refused to back down from his position.

definition_en: To explode; to enlarge.
example: The building blew up in the fire. / Can you blow up this photo?

definition_en: To make a significant advance or discovery.
definition_pt: Fazer um avanço ou descoberta significativa.
example: Scientists have broken through in cancer research.

definition_en: To bring someone or something with you.
definition_pt: Trazer alguém ou algo com você.
example: You can bring along a friend to the party.

definition_en: To cancel an event or agreement.
example: They called off the wedding at the last minute.

definition_en: To perform a task or experiment.
example: The study was carried out over three years.

definition_en: To reach someone who is ahead.
definition_pt: Alcançar alguém que está à frente.
example: I need to catch up with the rest of the class.

definition_en: To happen, especially in a way that is not planned.
definition_pt: Acontecer, especialmente de maneira não planejada.
example: How did this situation come about?

definition_en: To rely on someone or something.
example: You can count on me to help you move.

definition_en: To remove with a sharp tool; to isolate.
definition_pt: Remover com uma ferramenta afiada; isolar.
example: He cut off a piece of cheese. / The storm cut off the village.

definition_en: To manage without something.
example: We'll have to do without electricity tonight.

definition_en: To prepare a written document.
example: The lawyer will draw up the contract.

definition_en: To deliver someone or something; to decrease.
example: Can you drop me off at the station? / Sales have dropped off recently.

definition_en: To eventually reach a state, place, or situation.
definition_pt: Acabar em um estado, lugar ou situação.
example: If you don't study, you'll end up failing.

definition_en: To fall in love with; to be deceived by.
example: He fell for her immediately. / Don't fall for that trick.

definition_en: To understand or find a solution.
example: I need to figure out how to solve this problem.

definition_en: To yield to pressure or temptation.
example: Don't give in to their demands.

definition_en: To choose; to attack.
example: I think I'll go for the salad. / The dog went for the postman.

definition_en: To hesitate; to prevent from advancing.
example: Don't hold back, tell me what you think. / The police held back the crowd.

definition_en: To prevent from doing something.
example: I could hardly keep from laughing.

definition_en: To allow someone to know a secret.
definition_pt: Permitir que alguém saiba um segredo.
example: They let me in on their plan.

definition_en: To be as good as expected.
example: The restaurant lived up to its reputation.

definition_en: To see, hear, or understand something with difficulty.
definition_pt: Ver, ouvir ou entender algo com dificuldade.
example: I can't make out what this says.

definition_en: To be accepted as something else.
example: He could pass for someone much younger.

definition_en: To notice something subtle.
example: She quickly picked up on the tension in the room.

definition_en: To direct attention to something.
example: She pointed out an error in the report.

definition_en: To ignore or save for later.
example: Let's put aside our differences.

definition_en: To eliminate as a possibility.
example: The doctor ruled out a broken bone.

definition_en: To hit with a vehicle; to review.
example: The dog was run over by a car. / Let's run over the plan one more time.

definition_en: To begin a journey; to explain clearly.
example: They set out at dawn. / The rules are set out in this document.

definition_en: To be noticeably better or different.
example: Her red hair makes her stand out in a crowd.

definition_en: To speak to someone privately.
example: The manager took her aside to give her some feedback.

definition_en: To persuade someone to do something.
example: She talked me into going to the party.

definition_en: To go to someone for help or support.
definition_pt: Recorrer a alguém por ajuda ou apoio.
example: When I'm in trouble, I turn to my family.

definition_en: To have a particular cost or result.
definition_pt: Ter um custo ou resultado particular.
example: The total bill worked out at $50 per person.

definition_en: To explain; to constitute.
example: How do you account for your actions? / Imports account for 30% of sales.

definition_en: To be held responsible for something.
example: You will have to answer for your mistakes.

definition_en: To withdraw from a commitment.
example: He backed out of the deal at the last minute.

definition_en: To rescue someone from financial difficulty.
example: The government bailed out the bank.

definition_en: To confirm or support something.
example: The evidence bears out his story.

definition_en: To end a relationship or tradition.
example: He broke with his family over their political views.

definition_en: To produce; to present something.
example: The tree brings forth fruit in autumn. / She brought forth new evidence.

definition_en: To cause something to appear or happen.
example: The speech called forth a standing ovation.

definition_en: To obtain something; to visit.
example: How did you come by that painting? / Come by sometime for coffee.

definition_en: To appear or happen unexpectedly.
example: A problem has cropped up with the delivery.

definition_en: To abolish or get rid of something.
example: The law did away with the old tax system.

definition_en: To elicit information; to make something last longer.
definition_pt: Extrair informação; fazer algo durar mais.
example: The interviewer drew out his opinions. / She drew out the story for dramatic effect.

definition_en: To use something when in difficulty.
example: I have my savings to fall back on.

definition_en: To eventually find time to do something.
definition_pt: Finalmente encontrar tempo para fazer algo.
example: I finally got around to cleaning the garage.

definition_en: To participate in; to like or enjoy.
example: She goes in for tennis. / I don't go in for modern art.

definition_en: To wait for something better.
example: Don't accept the first offer; hold out for more money.

definition_en: To stay informed about something.
example: It's hard to keep up with all the news.

definition_en: To overcome embarrassment about something.
example: He'll never live down that embarrassing moment.

definition_en: To steal something and escape.
example: The thieves made off with the jewels.

definition_en: To ignore or not consider someone for promotion.
definition_pt: Ignorar ou não considerar alguém para promoção.
example: He was passed over for promotion again.

definition_en: To tidy things someone has left untidy.
definition_pt: Arrumar as coisas que alguém deixou bagunçadas.
example: I'm tired of picking up after you.

definition_en: To begin doing something.
example: She set about cleaning the entire house.

definition_en: To take someone's place temporarily.
definition_pt: Tomar o lugar de alguém temporariamente.
example: Can you stand in for me at the meeting?

definition_en: To make someone else suffer for your own bad feelings.
definition_pt: Fazer outra pessoa sofrer por seus próprios sentimentos ruins.
example: Don't take your frustration out on me.

definition_en: To progress gradually to something more difficult.
definition_pt: Progressar gradualmente para algo mais difícil.
example: I'm working up to running a marathon.

definition_en: To stop sleeping.
example: I wake up at 7 AM every day.

definition_en: To rise to a standing position.
definition_pt: Levantar-se para uma posição em pé.
example: Please stand up when the teacher enters the room.

definition_en: To lower oneself into a seated position.
example: Let's sit down and talk about this.

definition_en: To move toward the speaker.
example: Come here, I want to show you something.

definition_en: To place something on a surface.
example: Put down your bags and make yourself comfortable.

definition_en: To lift something from a surface.
example: Can you pick up that book for me?

definition_en: To direct your eyes toward something.
example: Look at this beautiful painting!

definition_en: To pay attention to sound.
example: I like to listen to music while I work.

definition_en: To put clothes on.
example: I need to get dressed before we go out.

definition_en: To take clothes off.
example: He got undressed and took a shower.

definition_en: To do something more quickly.
example: Hurry up or we'll be late!

definition_en: To reduce speed.
example: Slow down, you're driving too fast.

definition_en: To become calm or less agitated.
example: Please calm down and tell me what happened.

definition_en: To make something clean and tidy.
example: We need to clean up the kitchen after cooking.

definition_en: To wash dishes after a meal.
definition_pt: Lavar a louça após uma refeição.
example: I'll cook if you wash up afterwards.

definition_en: To put on clothing to see if it fits.
definition_pt: Vestir uma roupa para ver se serve.
example: I need to try on these shoes before I buy them.

definition_en: To turn off an electrical device.
example: Switch off your phone during the movie.

definition_en: To turn on an electrical device.
example: Switch on the lamp so we can see better.

definition_en: To connect an electrical device to a power source.
definition_pt: Conectar um dispositivo elétrico a uma fonte de energia.
example: Plug in your laptop so it can charge.

definition_en: To end a phone call.
example: I said goodbye and hung up the phone.

definition_en: To record information on paper.
example: Write down my phone number so you don't forget it.

definition_en: To return a phone call.
example: I'm busy right now, can I call you back later?

definition_en: To register at a hotel or airport.
definition_pt: Registrar-se em um hotel ou aeroporto.
example: We need to check in at the hotel before 3 PM.

definition_en: To leave a hotel after paying.
definition_pt: Sair de um hotel após pagar.
example: We checked out of the hotel this morning.

definition_en: To complete a form by writing information.
example: Please fill in this application form with your details.

definition_en: To change from being a child to an adult.
example: He grew up in a small town in the countryside.

definition_en: To continue doing something.
example: Keep on practicing and you'll improve quickly.

definition_en: To invent a story or excuse.
example: He made up an excuse for being late to work.

definition_en: To have no more of something left.
example: We've run out of milk. I need to go to the store.

definition_en: To assemble or arrange something.
example: It took me two hours to set up the new computer.

definition_en: To exercise.
example: I work out at the gym three times a week.

definition_en: To perform a role or story.
example: The children acted out their favorite fairy tale.

definition_en: To calculate the total of numbers.
example: Add up all the expenses and see how much we spent.

definition_en: To support someone.
example: I'll back you up in the meeting if you need help.

definition_en: To greatly impress someone.
example: Her performance blew everyone away.

definition_en: To return something.
example: Can you bring back my book when you're finished?

definition_en: To visit someone briefly.
example: I'll call on you when I'm in your neighborhood.

definition_en: To reach someone who is ahead.
definition_pt: Alcançar alguém que está à frente.
example: I need to catch up on my reading this weekend.

definition_en: To become sick with an illness.
example: I think I'm coming down with a cold.

definition_en: To occur or happen unexpectedly.
example: Something urgent has come up and I can't meet you today.

definition_en: To reduce consumption or spending.
example: We need to cut back on our expenses this month.

definition_en: To reduce the amount of something.
example: I'm trying to cut down on coffee.

definition_en: To visit someone informally.
example: Feel free to drop by anytime you're in the area.

definition_en: To leave school or college before finishing.
definition_pt: Deixar a escola ou faculdade antes de terminar.
example: He dropped out of college to start his own business.

definition_en: To break into pieces.
example: The old book fell apart when I touched it.

definition_en: To have an argument with someone.
example: They fell out over money issues.

definition_en: To have a friendly relationship.
example: She gets along with all her coworkers.

definition_en: To move from place to place.
definition_pt: Mover-se de um lugar para outro.
example: It's easy to get around the city by public transportation.

definition_en: To clean teeth or hair with a brush.
definition_pt: Limpar dentes ou cabelo com uma escova.
example: Brush up your teeth before bed.

definition_en: To dispose of something.
example: Throw away the empty bottle.

definition_en: To stay in a place until someone arrives.
definition_pt: Ficar em um lugar até alguém chegar.
example: Wait for me at the bus stop.

definition_en: To speak with someone.
example: I need to talk to my teacher after class.

definition_en: To have a conversation with someone.
example: Can I speak to the manager, please?

definition_en: To consider something.
example: I need to think about your proposal.

definition_en: To engage in activity for enjoyment.
example: The children play with their toys.

definition_en: To have a meal at a restaurant.
definition_pt: Fazer uma refeição em um restaurante.
example: Let's eat out tonight.

definition_en: To finish your drink.
example: Drink up your milk before it gets warm.

definition_en: To read something aloud.
example: The teacher read out the story to the class.

definition_en: To sing with someone else.
example: Everyone sang along with the popular song.

definition_en: To move to the rhythm of music.
example: The children danced to the music.

definition_en: To run in different directions.
example: The kids ran around in the park.

definition_en: To propel oneself upward.
example: The dog jumped up to catch the ball.

definition_en: To move upward using hands and feet.
definition_pt: Mover-se para cima usando mãos e pés.
example: The cat climbed up the tree.

definition_en: To assist someone.
example: Can you help out with the dishes?

definition_en: To request something.
example: Don't be afraid to ask for help.

definition_en: To give money in exchange for something.
definition_pt: Dar dinheiro em troca de algo.
example: I'll pay for the tickets.

definition_en: To escape from a place or situation.
definition_pt: Escapar de um lugar ou situação.
example: We need to get away from this crowded place.

definition_en: To accompany someone.
example: I'll go along with you to the store.

definition_en: To pass (time).
example: The days go by quickly when you're busy.

definition_en: To make a sudden loud noise (alarm).
example: The fire alarm went off in the middle of the night.

definition_en: To move to a higher level.
example: Prices go up every year.

definition_en: To gradually become less close to someone.
definition_pt: Gradualmente tornar-se menos próximo de alguém.
example: We were best friends in school but grew apart over the years.

definition_en: To become large enough to wear something.
definition_pt: Tornar-se grande o suficiente para usar algo.
example: The shoes are too big now, but he'll grow into them.

definition_en: To submit something formally.
example: Please hand in your assignments by Friday.

definition_en: To distribute something to a group of people.
definition_pt: Distribuir algo para um grupo de pessoas.
example: The teacher handed out the test papers.

definition_en: To give something to someone else.
example: Hand over the money and no one gets hurt.

definition_en: To spend time in a place without any specific purpose.
definition_pt: Passar tempo em um lugar sem nenhum propósito específico.
example: We used to hang around the mall after school.

definition_en: To wait for a short time.
example: Hang on, I'll be right with you.

definition_en: To spend time relaxing or socializing informally.
definition_pt: Passar tempo relaxando ou socializando informalmente.
example: Let's hang out at my place this weekend.

definition_en: To delay someone or something.
example: Sorry I'm late, I was held up in traffic.

definition_en: To avoid going near something or someone.
definition_pt: Evitar aproximar-se de algo ou alguém.
example: Keep away from the edge of the cliff.

definition_en: To not give or tell something.
example: He kept back some important information.

definition_en: To keep something at a low level.
definition_pt: Manter algo em um nível baixo.
example: We need to keep down the noise.

definition_en: To avoid touching or entering something.
definition_pt: Evitar tocar ou entrar em algo.
example: Keep off the grass.

definition_en: To hit someone so they fall to the ground.
definition_pt: Bater em alguém para que caia no chão.
example: The boxer knocked down his opponent.

definition_en: To make someone unconscious.
example: The blow to the head knocked him out.

definition_en: To accept and follow a decision, rule, or agreement.
definition_pt: Aceitar e seguir uma decisão, regra ou acordo.
example: All members must abide by the club's regulations.

definition_en: To deal with or take care of something.
definition_pt: Lidar com ou cuidar de algo.
example: I have some urgent matters to attend to first.

definition_en: To form a group to achieve something.
definition_pt: Formar um grupo para alcançar algo.
example: The community banded together to clean up the park.

definition_en: To work hard and diligently at something.
definition_pt: Trabalhar arduamente e com diligência em algo.
example: She's been beavering away at that project all week.

definition_en: To recover quickly after a setback.
example: The company bounced back stronger after the crisis.

definition_en: To expand into new areas or activities.
definition_pt: Expandir para novas áreas ou atividades.
example: The company is branching out into international markets.

definition_en: To neither make a profit nor suffer a loss.
definition_pt: Nem ter lucro nem sofrer perda.
example: It took two years for the business to break even.

definition_en: To make someone conscious again.
example: The smelling salts brought him round quickly.

definition_en: To start working seriously at something.
definition_pt: Começar a trabalhar seriamente em algo.
example: You need to buckle down if you want to pass those exams.

definition_en: To move to make space for someone.
definition_pt: Mover-se para dar espaço para alguém.
example: Budge up so I can sit down too.

definition_en: To accept that an idea is true; to purchase shares.
definition_pt: Aceitar que uma ideia é verdadeira; comprar ações.
example: I don't buy into that conspiracy theory. / He bought into the company early.

definition_en: To purchase someone's share of a business.
definition_pt: Comprar a parte de alguém em um negócio.
example: The partners bought him out for millions.

definition_en: To ask for the services of someone professional.
definition_pt: Pedir os serviços de alguém profissional.
example: We had to call in a specialist to fix the problem.

definition_en: To succeed in doing something difficult.
definition_pt: Ter sucesso em fazer algo difícil.
example: She carried off the performance despite being ill.

definition_en: To search anxiously for something.
example: He was casting about for a solution to the problem.

definition_en: To get rid of something or someone.
example: She cast aside her doubts and pursued her dream.

definition_en: To attribute something to a particular cause; to record.
definition_pt: Atribuir algo a uma causa particular; registrar.
example: We can chalk up the success to good planning. / Chalk up another victory for our team.

definition_en: To accuse someone of something, especially legally.
definition_pt: Acusar alguém de algo, especialmente legalmente.
example: He was charged with embezzlement.

definition_en: To try to make something happen more quickly.
definition_pt: Tentar fazer algo acontecer mais rapidamente.
example: I need to chase up that delivery—it's late.

definition_en: To be unfaithful to a partner.
example: She discovered he'd been cheating on her for months.

definition_en: To make sure someone is behaving correctly.
definition_pt: Certificar-se de que alguém está se comportando corretamente.
example: The boss checks up on our progress weekly.

definition_en: To decide not to do something because of fear.
definition_pt: Decidir não fazer algo por medo.
example: He was going to bungee jump but chickened out at the last moment.

definition_en: To produce large quantities of something mechanically.
definition_pt: Produzir grandes quantidades de algo mecanicamente.
example: The factory churns out thousands of units daily.

definition_en: To suddenly become silent or refuse to speak.
definition_pt: Subitamente calar-se ou recusar-se a falar.
example: He clammed up when the police started asking questions.

definition_en: To take strict action to prevent something.
definition_pt: Tomar ação rigorosa para prevenir algo.
example: The government is clamping down on illegal immigration.

definition_en: To be able to be explained by a single important point.
definition_pt: Poder ser explicado por um único ponto importante.
example: It all comes down to whether we can secure funding.

definition_en: To receive criticism or blame.
example: The government has come in for severe criticism recently.

definition_en: To inherit money or property.
example: She came into a fortune when her grandfather died.

definition_en: To succeed; to happen as planned.
example: The event came off without any problems.

definition_en: To say something suddenly or unexpectedly.
example: He came out with a ridiculous excuse.

definition_en: To change your opinion to agree with someone.
definition_pt: Mudar sua opinião para concordar com alguém.
example: Eventually she came round to my way of thinking.

definition_en: To have to deal with a problem or difficulty.
definition_pt: Ter que lidar com um problema ou dificuldade.
example: We've come up against some unexpected opposition.

definition_en: To bring a thought, picture, or memory to your mind.
definition_pt: Trazer um pensamento, imagem ou memória à sua mente.
example: The smell conjured up memories of my grandmother's kitchen.

definition_en: To begin to understand or realize something.
definition_pt: Começar a compreender ou perceber algo.
example: It took me a while to cotton on to what they were doing.

definition_en: To need something urgently.
example: The education system is crying out for reform.
